item.title: Lawsuit Filed Against the Sweeps and the City’s Ongoing...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Lawsuit Filed Against the Sweeps and the City’s Ongoing Violations of Lawsuit Settlement

Today, October 5th 2020, a lawsuit and motion for preliminary injunction was filed against the City of Denver for violating constitutional rights of homeless individuals, and violating the agreed upon settlement from Lyall v CIty of Denver, in on-going sweeps. The suit is filed by Andrew McNaulty of Killmer Lane and Newman on behalf of 10 homeless individuals as well as all others in the ...class of homeless people and those of us from Denver Homeless Out Loud who have suffered from sweeps. This case seeks an injunction to stop the homeless sweeps (and enforcement of the Camping Ban) during the COVID-19 pandemic (and afterwards), the seizure of homeless individuals’ property without notice, the destruction of homeless individuals’ property, and the continuing violation of the Lyall v. Denver settlement agreement.

This lawsuit comes after a series of egregious sweeps conducted by the City with no notice at Lincoln Park at the end of July, Morey Middle School at the beginning of August, and along the South Platte River a week ago. In addition, at least 20 other sweeps, plus daily camping ban enforcement, have continued to occur during the COVID-19 pandemic.

The City cannot continue to blatantly violate the rights of people without housing and furthermore violate the settlement agreement they made with the homeless community to give proper notice prior to sweeps and to store property instead of trashing it. The City cannot continue to ignore CDC guidance to not sweep and to instead provide sanitation resources where people live in encampments.

Plaintiffs in this case lost medications, irreplaceable memorabilia, all their protection from the elements, and have been pushed into congregate shelters where one lead plaintiff with a heart condition could have died when they caught COVID.

Our City refuses to listen to the cries of the people to stop this inhumane insanity, so we have no choice but to take this cry to the courts.

Pictures of lead plaintiff and neighbors of 14th and Logan camp speaking at press conference today

See More+27

item.title: We Raised almost 20k for Sanitation Resources THANKS to YOU!!...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

We Raised almost 20k for Sanitation Resources THANKS to YOU!!

Throughout the month of September we raised almost $20k toward maintaining our Sanitation Stations at encampments!! That is huge!!! THANK YOU SOOO MUCH to all of you who have donated to make this possible! With this amount we can pay for at least September - November. We also received a large number of recurring donations!! With these recurring donations it may add up to the $5k more we need to continue to pay for ...these services at the 5 encampments we are currently serving for the rest of 2020!

If anyone else want to make a recurring donation to ensure we can pay for these station for teh rest of 2020 please do! You can donate on paypal, check, or with cash as laid out on this link.
https://denverhomelessoutloud.org/donate/

What does this pay for exactly?? Five portable toilets serviced 5 days a week, moving charges after police sweeps, pay for a resident of the encampment to do an extra cleaning of the portable toilet each day, cleaning supplies, and some of the supplies to maintain the handwashing stations (done together with Mutual Aid Denver).

This should be the city’s responsibility. The city currently has a contract with Liberty Waste that could pay for portable toilets and handwashing stations at every encampment around town. CDC guidance tells cities to provide these sanitation resources to every encampment of 10 people or more. But they continue to ignore our demand that this basic human resource be provided. We will continue to make this demand heard…

We have submitted the attached budget proposals to city council to pay for these services in 2021. Email your council person to ask these budget items be brought forward and passed!

In the meanwhile… your donations to pay for toilets and handwashing ensures at least 5 encampments, totaling at least 350 people, have access to a toilet and soap and wash their hands. Something every person needs and deserves.

Please contact us with any questions.

Thank you all sooooo much for helping fund these services for almost the rest of 2020!!

Contact us at:
info@denverhomelessoutloud.org
720-940-5291

See More

denverhomelessoutloud.org

Donate

Here are some ways you can help with the finances… 1. item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SAME OLD, SAME OLD Denver HOST Housing Plan Continues Mass Homelessness and Housing Instability in 2021

...But they pretend they are doing great things. The Denver Department of Housing Stability (HOST) has released their 2021 draft plan https://www.denvergov.org/…/2021ActionPlan_DraftforReview09…. The draft plan takes 28 pages to say that they will not be creating housing for those without housing or severely cost burdened trying to afford their housing. The plan gives impor...

item.title: "On Tuesday, a bulldozer scooped up tents, tarps,...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"On Tuesday, a bulldozer scooped up tents, tarps, suitcases, even a patio umbrella that had sheltered someone who was absent when the clean-up began"
-------------------

So ah... where are these billionaire sports team owners when it comes to housing our poor? And where are these multi million dollar athletes? If they don't want the poor huddled around their stadiums they could house them and be real heros for a change.

...

https://denverite.com/…/the-city-sweeps-a-homeless-encampm…/

See MoreThe city says such cleanups are necessary to maintain the public right of way.

denverite.com

The city sweeps a homeless encampment near Coors Field

item.title: Personal Property Trashed in Sweep Today - Sweep Tomorrow Yet...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Personal Property Trashed in Sweep Today - Sweep Tomorrow Yet Again...

The City of Denver TRASHed about 15 tents and all these people’s property today in their sweep of the encampment formerly at 21st and Market. You can scroll through our facebook live videos here to watch tents and the property within be trashed with a bulldozer one after the other. The City tries to say they can trash all of someone’s possessions if they find one needle in the tent - this is entirely contr...adictory to the settlement agreement which states that hazardous items (like needles) can be trash, but does not say all that person’s possessions can then be trashed.

Just after sweeping 21st and Market, police and sweeps crews went to 22nd and Wazze where a number of folks are living and many folks from 21st and Market moved. This area was not posted for a sweep. The City crew was there supposedly just “cleaning”, but in the midst of this instead of just taking trash they TRASHed someone’s whole tent and all the property in it as if it was just trash, not someone’s home. Video of this can be seen here. This is an explicit violation of the lawsuit settlement which requires notice be given before property is taken, and clearly defines tents, sleeping gear, and the like as property not trash. To come through on a day not posted for a sweep and through personal property (someone’s home) in the trash is both a violation of rights and immoral. This type of action forces people to stay at their tent day and night - not go seek work, get food, or anything - just sit at their tent 24/7, just in case the City comes by to trash their property. We cannot stand for this treatment!@#

Tomorrow there is another sweep planned for 25th and Welton. Many of the residents of this block have been living there for many months. These residents will again be scattered to nowhere. City officials even told us they would not provide hotel vouchers to all these residents.

Where the HECK do they expect people to go…^%??

Housing Not Sweeps
Humanity Not Hate

See More
